Title: the parking spot escalation

Scene: The parking spot. Sheldon is trying to push Howard’s car out of the spot.
The parking spot. Sheldon is spraypainting out Howard’s name and replacing it with his own.
The parking spot. Sheldon has set up his office in it.
Leonard: Your hypothesis is completely disconfirmed by all the data. You’re just clinging to it out of intellectual stubbornness.
Oh, yeah? Mummies are wrapped in bandages.
All right, you brought this on yourself. Sheldon, get him.
Maybe they reassigned it because you never use it.
Well, he’s not wrong. Howard did go to the International Space Station.
Sheldon, let it go. It’s not a big deal.
All that story does is make me feel bad for your mother.
Because I can never understand your side.
You’re both acting like lunatics. It’s just a parking spot.
What I don’t believe is that you tried to run him over.
Raj: No, you’re displaying a shocking ignorance of the subject matter. Mummies and zombies are the exact same thing.
Congratulations. Does it have that new car smell?
Why do you have a parking spot? You don’t have a car. You don’t even drive.
I didn’t pick up on that. That’s a nice touch.
Calm down. Howard has something he wants to say to you.
Howard, that’s not how we practiced it.
Sheldon: If a zombie bites you, you turn into a zombie. However, if a mummy bites you, all you turn into is some schmo with a mummy bite. So, like a zombie, that’s been eaten from the waist down, you, sir, have no leg to stand on.
Oh, thank you.
I’m sorry, 294?
That’s my parking spot.
It doesn’t matter. That’s my spot.
Well, I’m not using my nipples, either. Maybe they should reassign those.

I don’t want another parking space. I want my parking space. It’s perfect. It’s a corner spot, cutting the risk of door-dings in half. It’s a mere 28 steps from the building entrance. The nearby tree provides shade on hot days and is also home to a delightful squirrel. Which is fortuitous because most squirrels are real jerks.
Don’t try to change the subject. This is about a parking space. It has nothing to do with cars.
I always listen to myself. It’s one of the great joys of my life. Now, get your car out of my spot.
Very well. You leave me no choice.
What are you looking at, you stupid squirrel?
Yeah, that was five weeks ago. How much longer is he gonna milk that cow?

No, no, this is a slippery slope, Leonard. It starts with a parking space, where does it end? It’s like my dad always said, first they say you can’t drink and drive, next thing you know, you can’t let your 10-year-old take the wheel while you sleep one off in the backseat.
Leonard, you’re my best friend. Why don’t you ever take my side?
I’m sorry, but could you be more specific?
Oh, that. Well, see, I wanted it, and you weren’t using it. Apparently, those are the rules we live by now. Payback, it truly is the B word, isn’t it?
I’d love to help you out, but unfortunately (puts helmet on), I’m using it.
Go ahead. That’s the only doctorate you’ll ever get. It smells funny in here.
Cookie.
Well, I’m not giving it away. (Enters apartment. Howard is sitting naked in his spot with a laptop on his lap)
He’s in my spot. Leonard, make him stop being naked in my spot.
Get off there.
Give me back my parking space.
You don’t need an Iron Man helmet. You’re not Iron Man.
Keep a lookout. This place is swarming with campus security. They will not hesitate to scold us.
Oh, yeah. Okay, now, pull your car into the spot and let’s get out of here.
Yes, and be sure and put on the emergency brake. Really makes these things tough to budge.
All right, colour me intrigued.
I think you’re high on paint fumes. And boy, that’s a lot of Band-Aids.
Morning, Professor Stevens. Don’t look at that whiteboard. That’s my math, not your math. Keep walking, nosey.
Oh. You said I’m not using my space, so I’m using it.
No, I don’t.

Actually, I have a plastic baggy strapped to my leg that says I can. Give up, Wolowitz. You’ve chosen to tangle with a superior intellect you can’t defeat. There is nothing you could possibly do to… (Howard starts sounding his horn. Sheldon puts on earphones)
Oh, yes, they are. I mean, what?
Your threats are empty, nothing can move me. (Howard starts pushing his chair with the front of the car) Stop that.
No. That’s it. I am calling campus security. You prepare for the scolding of your life.
He’s trying to kill me, Leonard. Video games and rock music have desensitized him to violence.

Oh, preposterous. I have been solely responsible for this university’s six loop quantum gravity calculations, I have changed the way we think about Bose-Einstein condensates, and I am also the one who got Nutter Butters in the cafeteria vending machine. Maybe you missed that news while you were floating around like a goof in outer space. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have work to do.
Hey, sweet ride.
Just breaking in your new car.
You know what they say? Revenge is a dish best served nude.
Oh, of course, come in. (Raj opens door to reveal Howard) This is an authentic Chinese throwing star, and I must warn you, I have seen many people throw them in movies.
Well, Howard, thank you. It’s quite a gesture on your part. You’ve shown yourself to be the bigger man.
Which I find totally unacceptable. I must be the bigger man. Therefore, you may use my spot until such time as I learn to drive or get a Batmobile.
There is nothing to say. Except I’m the bigger man. I’m not kidding. Say it.
Oh, stop. And I believe this is yours. FYI, if you wear that into a bank, they will tackle you to the ground.
To burying the hatchet.

Yes. According to information I gleaned from Yelp, you had great success when a santeriasuzy37 brought you a pair of leather slacks stained with chicken blood. I believe I may have a similar problem. This cushion experienced a nude revenge wiggle.
A naked man sat on it. Now, here’s my concern, his diet is rich in fatty deli meats. What test do you have to detect lipid residue?
Lipid residue. An anal autograph. A colon calling card, if you will.
Don’t rush it. We may be dealing with befoulment on a molecular level.
Is that your son?

Looks like that laptop’s seen better days. If you’re interested, I’m selling this. It’s only two years old, 16 gigabytes of RAM, Intel core i7 processor, and I can personally guarantee it has spent less than 20 minutes resting on an astronaut’s penis.
Howard: Hey, fellas, what’s going on?
Oh, they’re not the same thing.
Thanks. Guess who picked up his new car this morning?
Yep. For as long as I can keep my mother out of it. If you want to check it out later, it’s parked right out front, space 294.
Yeah.
Sheldon, someday, if you get a car, I’m sure they’ll give you another parking space.
Fun story. Meanwhile, you still don’t have a car.
Are you listening to yourself?
Nope.
Give it back.
My Iron Man helmet. Koothrappali saw you take it. Give it back.
Sheldon, that is a five hundred dollar limited edition collectible, and I want it back.
Fine. I’m taking your diploma.
Hi Sheldon.
He wasn’t using it. And I needed a nice cool piece of leather to wiggle my naked ass on.
Give me back my Iron Man helmet.
You don’t need a parking space. You don’t have a car.
Well, we appear to have reached an impasse. And you know, I have to say, I thought you’d be more upset that your laptop is sitting on my junk.
What the hell are you doing?
Okay, you need to move now.
You can’t stay there forever.
Those aren’t gonna help you, Sheldon,
I’m warning you, Sheldon!
Get out of my spot.
Would you please talk some sense into your lunatic roommate?
It’s not just a parking spot. He can’t handle the fact that I’m a bigger deal than he is now.
Can you believe this guy?
Oh, like you’ve never thought of doing that. Don’t hate me just because I lived the dream. (Horn beeps. Sheldon is sitting naked in Howard’s car.)
What are you doing in there?
Stop that. You stop that.
All right. Sheldon, when this whole thing with the parking space started, I had no idea just how much of a crazy bastard…
I had no idea how much that spot meant to you. Anyway, I called President Siebert and told him it’s not worth fighting over the spot, so you keep it, and I’ll park in the structure across the street.
Thank you.
Wow, okay. Well, thanks. I don’t know what to say.
You’re the bigger man, Sheldon.
I’d like to propose a toast, to burying the hatchet.
Sheldon (on phone): President Siebert, listen to reason. Yeah, I understand I don’t use the parking spot, but that’s not the point. I… Yes, I’m aware you told me not to call you at home, but you didn’t answer the door. And I know you were there, because I saw you through the mail slot. Yeah, well, that’s some salty language. May I remind you that you’re the president of a major university, not the president of the Potty Mouth Club. There it is again. Do you kiss your mother with that mouth? Oh, well, I’m sorry for your loss. Good night, sir. Unbelievable. He says Wolowitz deserves my spot because he’s a high-profile asset to the university.
Bernadette: We’re so proud of you, Amy. Your first bikini wax.
Really? Only five?
Okay. So, did you spend last night hearing about this silly parking space fight, too?
Howard was so angry I had to mash up Benadryl in his ice cream to get him to fall asleep.
I’m really sorry they took Sheldon’s spot away. He shouldn’t have to suffer just because Howard’s such a big deal now.
What’s that supposed to mean?
You’re right. And I’m sure Sheldon will get a fancy parking spot again, if and when he makes a worthwhile contribution to science.
Hang on. None of Sheldon’s theories have ever been definitively proven. My husband actually went to outer space.
Gosh, Amy. I’m sensing a little hostility. Is it maybe because, like Sheldon’s work, your sex life is also theoretical?
I don’t have to take this. I’m gonna go home and have sex with my husband right now. Maybe I’ll let him do it to me in the parking spot. Which sounds dirty, but I didn’t mean it that way,
What can I tell ya? She’s a big girl. Wherever you look, there she is. More coffee?
He’s not here. What’s wrong?
Oh, no. Where was it parked?
That doesn’t make sense. Sheldon doesn’t have a spot. Was it maybe in Howard’s spot?
Well, that doesn’t make sense, either.
Because I’m the one who had it towed.
Didn’t see that one coming, did ya?
Are you okay?!
Don’t move. I’ll get some ice.
Here.
Amy, you think maybe this has gotten a little out of hand?
You hit her! What did I do?
You were parked in Howard’s spot.
Sheldon doesn’t have a spot.
Okay, let’s go.
The tow truck didn’t scratch your car.
‘Cause I did it!
You know, I’m kind of glad this happened.
Penny: Uh, no, they usually don’t have to go out and get more wax.
I’m assuming these are some kind of horns they bought at Comic-Con?
Okay, maybe we should change the subject. Um, Amy, how are your lady parts? Still chilly down there?
You know, I remember the first time I got a bikini wax. My sister did it with melted Crayolas and duct tape. It’s a bad idea.
Anyway, to this day, I still can’t see a box of crayons without crossing my legs.
Okay, Howard’s mother is in, like, every one of your wedding photos.
No, Leonard’s taking me to a physics lecture, and coffee’ll just keep me awake. (Knock on door) Oh, I’ll get it.
You idiot, what the hell do you have in there?!
Get away from me or I swear to God I will rip out what’s left of your pubes!
Guys, I think I need to go to the emergency room.
Amy: A little sensitive, but not bad. Does it always take that long?
I feel like I’m five pounds lighter.
Sure.
For hours. Fortunately, I couldn’t understand most of it ’cause Sheldon was wearing that stupid robot mask.
I guess this is what we get for being with two testosterone-fueled alpha males. At some point, they’re bound to lock horns.
I know, Sheldon should just let Howard have his little moment in the sun.
Well, I mean, Howard’s never gonna go to space again, but Sheldon will always be a genius.
If and when?
That’s an impressive accomplishment. He’s now an inspiration to millions of Americans who know you don’t have to be special or even qualified to go into space.

Yeah, well, at least when we do make love, Sheldon won’t be thinking about his mother. And yes, that is a cleverly veiled reference to Howard’s lifelong obsession to crawl back into her spacious womb.
This is so exciting. I’m feeling all tingly. Although that could just be my newly defoliated bikini zone.
Freaking pigs.
Wait, I’m leaving my car here?
Before I park, come in the back seat. I want to show you something I had done today.
What do you think?
Oh, looks like someone’s on Team Bernadette. Where’s Howard?
He had my car towed. It cost me two hundred dollars to get it back.
In Sheldon’s spot.
Don’t play dumb with me, sister. You tell your husband he owes me two hundred dollars.
Why not?
You?
Oh, yeah? Well, you’re not gonna see this coming. (Swings handbag. Bernadette ducks. Penny is hit in the face)
Oh, my God,
Just my wallet, keys and a coffee can full of change I’ve been meaning to take to the bank.
Are you okay?
I do. Penny, Bernadette and I are sorry.
You had my car towed.
I was parked in Sheldon’s spot.
I’ll drive. You can see where the tow truck scratched my car.
How do you know?
Me, too. In some weird way, I kind of feel like it brought us closer.
Raj: Okay, here\u2019s another one: If a zombie bites a vampire, and the vampire bites a human, does the human become a vampire or a zombie? Or a zompire?
Shopkeeper: Let me write you a ticket.

No, you’re displaying a shocking ignorance of the subject matter. Mummies and zombies are the exact same thing.
Oh, yeah? Mummies are wrapped in bandages.
All right, you brought this on yourself. Sheldon, get him.

Thanks. Guess who picked up his new car this morning?
Congratulations. Does it have that new car smell?
Yep. For as long as I can keep my mother out of it. If you want to check it out later, it’s parked right out front, space 294.
Why do you have a parking spot? You don’t have a car. You don’t even drive.
It doesn’t matter. That’s my spot.
Maybe they reassigned it because you never use it.
Well, I’m not using my nipples, either. Maybe they should reassign those.
Sheldon, someday, if you get a car, I’m sure they’ll give you another parking space.

What are you looking at, you stupid squirrel?

He’s in my spot. Leonard, make him stop being naked in my spot.
He wasn’t using it. And I needed a nice cool piece of leather to wiggle my naked ass on.
Give me back my Iron Man helmet.
Give me back my parking space.
You don’t need a parking space. You don’t have a car.
You don’t need an Iron Man helmet. You’re not Iron Man.
Well, we appear to have reached an impasse. And you know, I have to say, I thought you’d be more upset that your laptop is sitting on my junk.
I didn’t pick up on that. That’s a nice touch.

This is so exciting. I’m feeling all tingly. Although that could just be my newly defoliated bikini zone.
Keep a lookout. This place is swarming with campus security. They will not hesitate to scold us.
Oh, yeah. Okay, now, pull your car into the spot and let’s get out of here.
Wait, I’m leaving my car here?
Yes, and be sure and put on the emergency brake. Really makes these things tough to budge.
Before I park, come in the back seat. I want to show you something I had done today.
I think you’re high on paint fumes. And boy, that’s a lot of Band-Aids.

Didn’t see that one coming, did ya?
Oh, yeah? Well, you’re not gonna see this coming. (Swings handbag. Bernadette ducks. Penny is hit in the face)

Don’t move. I’ll get some ice.

I do. Penny, Bernadette and I are sorry.
You hit her! What did I do?
You were parked in Howard’s spot.
I was parked in Sheldon’s spot.
Guys, I think I need to go to the emergency room.
I’ll drive. You can see where the tow truck scratched my car.
The tow truck didn’t scratch your car.

What the hell are you doing?
Oh. You said I’m not using my space, so I’m using it.
Okay, you need to move now.

Looks like that laptop’s seen better days. If you’re interested, I’m selling this. It’s only two years old, 16 gigabytes of RAM, Intel core i7 processor, and I can personally guarantee it has spent less than 20 minutes resting on an astronaut’s penis.
